name: D. 7.1 - Adult and Adolescent intake Form

answers.label: Recurrent or chronic Bacterial URTIs (Sinusitis, Otitis Media, Ottorhea, Tonsillitis)
Chronic herpes simplex virus infection (orolabial or visceral)
Acute necrotizing Ulcerative gingivitis or periodontitis
Extra pulmonary TB except Lymph node TB
Chronic herpes simplex virus infection (orolabial, genital or anorectal)
Recurrent Bacterial URTIs (Sinusitis, Otitis Media, Tonsillopharyngitis )
Severe Bacterial Infections (Pneumonia, Septic arthritis, osteomyelitis, Pyomyositis, PID)
Ear pain, discharge or decreased hearing
Rheumatoid Arthritis, Joint Pain or Joint Swelling Today

questions.label: Weight loss/Failure to thrive(% of body weight)

alert.message: Systolic is out of range (Normal range 120-130)

validators.message: Blood Pressure Systolic should not be less than 0

alert.message: Diastolic is out of range (Normal range 80-85)

validators.message: Boold Pressure Diastolic should not be less than 0

alert.message: Respiratory Rate is out of range (Normal range 12-16)

validators.message: Respiratory Rate should not be less than 0

alert.message: Temperature is out of range (Normal range 35-37)

validators.message: Temperature should not be less than 0
Weight should not be less than 0kg and should not exceed 150kg
Height should not be less than 0cm or should not exceed 200cm
BMI should not be less than 0
CD4 Count should not be less than 0
CD4% should not be less than 0 or above 100%
MUAC should not be less than 0

answers.label: Moderate unexplained weight loss (< 10% of body weight)
Recurrent bacterial upper respiratory tract infections (two or more in last 6 months): sinusitis, otitis media, tonsillopharyngitis
Recurrent oral ulcerations (two or more episodes in last 6 months)
Acute necrotizing ulcerative stomatitis, gingivitis or periodontitis
Severe bacterial infection (e.g. pneumonia, meningitis, empyema, pyomyositis, bone or joint infection, bacteremia, severe pelvic inflammatory disease)
Severe unexplained weight loss (more than 10% of body weight)
Unexplained anemia (below 8g/dl), neutropenia (below 500/microliter) and/or chronic (more than 1 month) thrombocytopenia (below 50,000/microliter)
Unexplained chronic diarrhea for longer than 1 month
Unexplained persistent fever (intermittent or constant and lasting for longer than 1 month)
Chronic herpes simplex virus (HSV) infection (orolabial, genital or anorectal) > 1 month
HIV wasting syndrome (>10% weight loss + chronic diarrhea or chronic fever)
Lymphoma (cerebral or B cell non-Hodgkin) or other solid HIV associated tumors
Recurrent bacterial pneumonia (this episode plus one or more episodes in last 6 months)
